alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northern Gila County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 3:19AM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 11 inches possible, with 12 to 20 inches above 8000 feet. For locations between 6000 and 7000 feet including Show Low, Springerville, and Pinetop-Lakeside, snow accumulation will be minimal until after 5 PM Friday as colder air arrives. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Alpine, Eagar- Springerville, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard, Pine-Strawberry, Pinetop-Lakeside and Show Low. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute, and any New Year`s Eve travel plans. Snow forecast from 5 AM Friday to 11 AM Saturday: Alpine 6 to 10 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 2 to 4 inches Forest Lakes 7 to 11 inches Heber-Overgaard 2 to 4 inches Pine-Strawberry 1 to 3 inches Pinetop-Lkside 6 to 10 inches Show Low 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
